    9696             : 
    9697             : #ifdef EXEC_BACKEND
    9698             : 
    9699             : /*
    9700             :  *  These routines dump out all non-default GUC options into a binary
    9701             :  *  file that is read by all exec'ed backends.  The format is:
    9702             :  *
    9703             :  *      variable name, string, null terminated
    9704             :  *      variable value, string, null terminated
    9705             :  *      variable sourcefile, string, null terminated (empty if none)
    9706             :  *      variable sourceline, integer
    9707             :  *      variable source, integer
    9708             :  *      variable scontext, integer
    9709             :  */
    9710             : static void
    9711             : write_one_nondefault_variable(FILE *fp, struct config_generic *gconf)
    9712             : {
    9713             :     if (gconf->source == PGC_S_DEFAULT)
    9714             :         return;
    9715             : 
    9716             :     fprintf(fp, "%s", gconf->name);
    9717             :     fputc(0, fp);
    9718             : 
    9719             :     switch (gconf->vartype)
    9720             :     {
    9721             :         case PGC_BOOL:
    9722             :             {
    9723             :                 struct config_bool *conf = (struct config_bool *) gconf;
    9724             : 
    9725             :                 if (*conf->variable)
    9726             :                     fprintf(fp, "true");
    9727             :                 else
    9728             :                     fprintf(fp, "false");
    9729             :             }
    9730             :             break;
    9731             : 
    9732             :         case PGC_INT:
    9733             :             {
    9734             :                 struct config_int *conf = (struct config_int *) gconf;
    9735             : 
    9736             :                 fprintf(fp, "%d", *conf->variable);
    9737             :             }
    9738             :             break;
    9739             : 
    9740             :         case PGC_REAL:
    9741             :             {
    9742             :                 struct config_real *conf = (struct config_real *) gconf;
    9743             : 
    9744             :                 fprintf(fp, "%.17g", *conf->variable);
    9745             :             }
    9746             :             break;
    9747             : 
    9748             :         case PGC_STRING:
    9749             :             {
    9750             :                 struct config_string *conf = (struct config_string *) gconf;
    9751             : 
    9752             :                 fprintf(fp, "%s", *conf->variable);
    9753             :             }
    9754             :             break;
    9755             : 
    9756             :         case PGC_ENUM:
    9757             :             {

    9762             :             }

    9777             : void
    9778             : write_nondefault_variables(GucContext context)
    9779             : {
    9780             :     int         elevel;
    9781             :     FILE       *fp;
    9782             :     int         i;
    9783             : 
    9784             :     Assert(context == PGC_POSTMASTER || context == PGC_SIGHUP);
    9785             : 
    9786             :     elevel = (context == PGC_SIGHUP) ? LOG : ERROR;
    9787             : 
    9788             :     /*
    9789             :      * Open file
    9790             :      */
    9791             :     fp = AllocateFile(CONFIG_EXEC_PARAMS_NEW, "w");
    9792             :     if (!fp)
    9793             :     {
    9794             :         ereport(elevel,
    9795             :                 (errcode_for_file_access(),
    9796             :                  errmsg("could not write to file \"%s\": %m",
    9797             :                         CONFIG_EXEC_PARAMS_NEW)));
    9798             :         return;
    9799             :     }
    9800             : 
    9801             :     for (i = 0; i < num_guc_variables; i++)
    9802             :     {
    9803             :         write_one_nondefault_variable(fp, guc_variables[i]);
    9804             :     }
    9805             : 
    9806             :     if (FreeFile(fp))
    9807             :     {
    9808             :         ereport(elevel,
    9809             :                 (errcode_for_file_access(),
    9810             :                  errmsg("could not write to file \"%s\": %m",
    9811             :                         CONFIG_EXEC_PARAMS_NEW)));
    9812             :         return;
    9813             :     }
    9814             : 
    9815             :     /*
    9816             :      * Put new file in place.  This could delay on Win32, but we don't hold
    9817             :      * any exclusive locks.
    9818             :      */
    9819             :     rename(CONFIG_EXEC_PARAMS_NEW, CONFIG_EXEC_PARAMS);
    9820             : }
    9821             : 
    9822             : 
    9823             : /*
    9824             :  *  Read string, including null byte from file
    9825             :  *
    9826             :  *  Return NULL on EOF and nothing read
    9827             :  */
    9828             : static char *
    9829             : read_string_with_null(FILE *fp)
    9830             : {
    9831             :     int         i = 0,
    9832             :                 ch,
    9833             :                 maxlen = 256;
    9834             :     char       *str = NULL;
    9835             : 
    9836             :     do
    9837             :     {
    9838             :         if ((ch = fgetc(fp)) == EOF)
    9839             :         {
    9840             :             if (i == 0)
    9841             :                 return NULL;
    9842             :             else
    9843             :                 elog(FATAL, "invalid format of exec config params file");
    9844             :         }
    9845             :         if (i == 0)
    9846             :             str = guc_malloc(FATAL, maxlen);
    9847             :         else if (i == maxlen)
    9848             :             str = guc_realloc(FATAL, str, maxlen *= 2);
    9849             :         str[i++] = ch;
    9850             :     } while (ch != 0);
    9851             : 
    9852             :     return str;
    9853             : }
    9854             : 
    9855             : 
    9856             : /*
    9857             :  *  This routine loads a previous postmaster dump of its non-default
    9858             :  *  settings.
    9859             :  */
    9860             : void
    9861             : read_nondefault_variables(void)
    9862             : {
    9863             :     FILE       *fp;
    9864             :     char       *varname,
    9865             :                *varvalue,
    9866             :                *varsourcefile;
    9867             :     int         varsourceline;
    9868             :     GucSource   varsource;
    9869             :     GucContext  varscontext;
    9870             : 
    9871             :     /*
    9872             :      * Assert that PGC_BACKEND/PGC_SU_BACKEND case in set_config_option() will
    9873             :      * do the right thing.
    9874             :      */
    9875             :     Assert(IsInitProcessingMode());
    9876             : 
    9877             :     /*
    9878             :      * Open file
    9879             :      */
    9880             :     fp = AllocateFile(CONFIG_EXEC_PARAMS, "r");
    9881             :     if (!fp)
    9882             :     {
    9883             :         /* File not found is fine */
    9884             :         if (errno != ENOENT)
    9885             :             ereport(FATAL,
    9886             :                     (errcode_for_file_access(),
    9887             :                      errmsg("could not read from file \"%s\": %m",
    9888             :                             CONFIG_EXEC_PARAMS)));
    9889             :         return;
    9890             :     }
    9891             : 
    9892             :     for (;;)
    9893             :     {
    9894             :         struct config_generic *record;
    9895             : 
    9896             :         if ((varname = read_string_with_null(fp)) == NULL)
    9897             :             break;
    9898             : 
    9899             :         if ((record = find_option(varname, true, FATAL)) == NULL)
    9900             :             elog(FATAL, "failed to locate variable \"%s\" in exec config params file", varname);
    9901             : 
    9902             :         if ((varvalue = read_string_with_null(fp)) == NULL)
    9903             :             elog(FATAL, "invalid format of exec config params file");
    9904             :         if ((varsourcefile = read_string_with_null(fp)) == NULL)
    9905             :             elog(FATAL, "invalid format of exec config params file");
    9906             :         if (fread(&varsourceline, 1, sizeof(varsourceline), fp) != sizeof(varsourceline))
    9907             :             elog(FATAL, "invalid format of exec config params file");
    9908             :         if (fread(&varsource, 1, sizeof(varsource), fp) != sizeof(varsource))
    9909             :             elog(FATAL, "invalid format of exec config params file");
    9910             :         if (fread(&varscontext, 1, sizeof(varscontext), fp) != sizeof(varscontext))
    9911             :             elog(FATAL, "invalid format of exec config params file");
    9912             : 
    9913             :         (void) set_config_option(varname, varvalue,
    9914             :                                  varscontext, varsource,
    9915             :                                  GUC_ACTION_SET, true, 0, true);
    9916             :         if (varsourcefile[0])
    9917             :             set_config_sourcefile(varname, varsourcefile, varsourceline);
    9918             : 
    9919             :         free(varname);
    9920             :         free(varvalue);
    9921             :         free(varsourcefile);
    9922             :     }
    9923             : 
    9924             :     FreeFile(fp);
    9925             : }
    9926             : #endif                          /* EXEC_BACKEND */
    9927             : 
    9928             : /*
    9929             :  * can_skip_gucvar:
    9930             :  * When serializing, determine whether to skip this GUC.  When restoring, the
    9931             :  * negation of this test determines whether to restore the compiled-in default
    9932             :  * value before processing serialized values.
    9933             :  *
    9934             :  * A PGC_S_DEFAULT setting on the serialize side will typically match new
    9935             :  * postmaster children, but that can be false when got_SIGHUP == true and the
    9936             :  * pending configuration change modifies this setting.  Nonetheless, we omit
    9937             :  * PGC_S_DEFAULT settings from serialization and make up for that by restoring
    9938             :  * defaults before applying serialized values.
    9939             :  *
    9940             :  * PGC_POSTMASTER variables always have the same value in every child of a
    9941             :  * particular postmaster.  Most PGC_INTERNAL variables are compile-time
    9942             :  * constants; a few, like server_encoding and lc_ctype, are handled specially
    9943             :  * outside the serialize/restore procedure.  Therefore, SerializeGUCState()
    9944             :  * never sends these, and RestoreGUCState() never changes them.
    9945             :  *
    9946             :  * Role is a special variable in the sense that its current value can be an
    9947             :  * invalid value and there are multiple ways by which that can happen (like
    9948             :  * after setting the role, someone drops it).  So we handle it outside of
    9949             :  * serialize/restore machinery.
    9950             :  */
    9951             : static bool
    9952      385546 : can_skip_gucvar(struct config_generic *gconf)
    9953             : {
    9954     1092068 :     return gconf->context == PGC_POSTMASTER ||
    9955      716950 :         gconf->context == PGC_INTERNAL || gconf->source == PGC_S_DEFAULT ||
    9956       31560 :         strcmp(gconf->name, "role") == 0;
    9957             : }
    9958             : 
    9959             : /*
    9960             :  * estimate_variable_size:
    9961             :  *      Compute space needed for dumping the given GUC variable.
    9962             :  *
    9963             :  * It's OK to overestimate, but not to underestimate.
    9964             :  */
    9965             : static Size
    9966       70246 : estimate_variable_size(struct config_generic *gconf)
    9967             : {
    9968             :     Size        size;
    9969       70246 :     Size        valsize = 0;
    9970             : 
    9971       70246 :     if (can_skip_gucvar(gconf))
    9972       63420 :         return 0;
    9973             : 
    9974             :     /* Name, plus trailing zero byte. */
    9975        6826 :     size = strlen(gconf->name) + 1;
    9976             : 
    9977             :     /* Get the maximum display length of the GUC value. */
    9978        6826 :     switch (gconf->vartype)
    9979             :     {
    9980             :         case PGC_BOOL:
    9981             :             {
    9982        1450 :                 valsize = 5;    /* max(strlen('true'), strlen('false')) */
    9983             :             }
    9984        1450 :             break;
    9985             : 
    9986             :         case PGC_INT:
    9987             :             {
    9988        1560 :                 struct config_int *conf = (struct config_int *) gconf;
    9989             : 
    9990             :                 /*
    9991             :                  * Instead of getting the exact display length, use max
    9992             :                  * length.  Also reduce the max length for typical ranges of
    9993             :                  * small values.  Maximum value is 2147483647, i.e. 10 chars.
    9994             :                  * Include one byte for sign.
    9995             :                  */
    9996        1560 :                 if (Abs(*conf->variable) < 1000)
    9997        1114 :                     valsize = 3 + 1;
    9998             :                 else
    9999         446 :                     valsize = 10 + 1;
   10000             :             }
   10001        1560 :             break;
   10002             : 
   10003             :         case PGC_REAL:
   10004             :             {
   10005             :                 /*
   10006             :                  * We are going to print it with %e with REALTYPE_PRECISION
   10007             :                  * fractional digits.  Account for sign, leading digit,
   10008             :                  * decimal point, and exponent with up to 3 digits.  E.g.
   10009             :                  * -3.99329042340000021e+110
   10010             :                  */
   10011         346 :                 valsize = 1 + 1 + 1 + REALTYPE_PRECISION + 5;
   10012             :             }
   10013         346 :             break;
   10014             : 
   10015             :         case PGC_STRING:
   10016             :             {
   10017        2782 :                 struct config_string *conf = (struct config_string *) gconf;
   10018             : 
   10019             :                 /*
   10020             :                  * If the value is NULL, we transmit it as an empty string.
   10021             :                  * Although this is not physically the same value, GUC
   10022             :                  * generally treats a NULL the same as empty string.
   10023             :                  */
   10024        2782 :                 if (*conf->variable)
   10025        2782 :                     valsize = strlen(*conf->variable);
   10026             :                 else
   10027           0 :                     valsize = 0;
   10028             :             }
   10029        2782 :             break;
   10030             : 
   10031             :         case PGC_ENUM:
   10032             :             {
   10033         688 :                 struct config_enum *conf = (struct config_enum *) gconf;
   10034             : 
   10035         688 :                 valsize = strlen(config_enum_lookup_by_value(conf, *conf->variable));
   10036             :             }
   10037         688 :             break;
   10038             :     }
   10039             : 
   10040             :     /* Allow space for terminating zero-byte for value */

   10080             : /*
   10081             :  * do_serialize:
   10082             :  * Copies the formatted string into the destination.  Moves ahead the
   10083             :  * destination pointer, and decrements the maxbytes by that many bytes. If
   10084             :  * maxbytes is not sufficient to copy the string, error out.
   10085             :  */
   10086             : static void
   10087       20478 : do_serialize(char **destptr, Size *maxbytes, const char *fmt,...)
   10088             : {
   10089             :     va_list     vargs;
   10090             :     int         n;
   10091             : 
   10092       20478 :     if (*maxbytes <= 0)
   10093           0 :         elog(ERROR, "not enough space to serialize GUC state");
   10094             : 
   10095       20478 :     va_start(vargs, fmt);
   10096       20478 :     n = vsnprintf(*destptr, *maxbytes, fmt, vargs);
   10097       20478 :     va_end(vargs);
   10098             : 
   10099       20478 :     if (n < 0)
   10100             :     {
   10101             :         /* Shouldn't happen. Better show errno description. */
   10102           0 :         elog(ERROR, "vsnprintf failed: %m with format string \"%s\"", fmt);
   10103             :     }
   10104       20478 :     if (n >= *maxbytes)
   10105             :     {
   10106             :         /* This shouldn't happen either, really. */
   10107           0 :         elog(ERROR, "not enough space to serialize GUC state");
   10108             :     }
   10109             : 
   10110             :     /* Shift the destptr ahead of the null terminator */
   10111       20478 :     *destptr += n + 1;
   10112       20478 :     *maxbytes -= n + 1;
   10113       20478 : }

   10227             :  * read_gucstate:

   10352             : /*
   10353             :  * A little "long argument" simulation, although not quite GNU
   10354             :  * compliant. Takes a string of the form "some-option=some value" and
   10355             :  * returns name = "some_option" and value = "some value" in malloc'ed
   10356             :  * storage. Note that '-' is converted to '_' in the option name. If
   10357             :  * there is no '=' in the input string then value will be NULL.
   10358             :  */
   10359             : void
   10360        8900 : ParseLongOption(const char *string, char **name, char **value)
   10361             : {
   10362             :     size_t      equal_pos;
   10363             :     char       *cp;
   10364             : 
   10365        8900 :     AssertArg(string);
   10366        8900 :     AssertArg(name);
   10367        8900 :     AssertArg(value);
   10368             : 
   10369        8900 :     equal_pos = strcspn(string, "=");
   10370             : 
   10371        8900 :     if (string[equal_pos] == '=')
   10372             :     {
   10373        8900 :         *name = guc_malloc(FATAL, equal_pos + 1);
   10374        8900 :         strlcpy(*name, string, equal_pos + 1);
   10375             : 
   10376        8900 :         *value = guc_strdup(FATAL, &string[equal_pos + 1]);
   10377             :     }
   10378             :     else
   10379             :     {
   10380             :         /* no equal sign in string */
   10381           0 :         *name = guc_strdup(FATAL, string);
   10382           0 :         *value = NULL;
   10383             :     }
   10384             : 
   10385      122300 :     for (cp = *name; *cp; cp++)

   10451             : /*
   10452             :  * Add an entry to an option array.  The array parameter may be NULL

   10669             : 
   10670             : /*
   10671             :  * Validate a proposed option setting for GUCArrayAdd/Delete/Reset.
   10672             :  *
   10673             :  * name is the option name.  value is the proposed value for the Add case,
   10674             :  * or NULL for the Delete/Reset cases.  If skipIfNoPermissions is true, it's
   10675             :  * not an error to have no permissions to set the option.
   10676             :  *
   10677             :  * Returns true if OK, false if skipIfNoPermissions is true and user does not
   10678             :  * have permission to change this option (all other error cases result in an
   10679             :  * error being thrown).
   10680             :  */
   10681             : static bool
   10682          38 : validate_option_array_item(const char *name, const char *value,
   10683             :                            bool skipIfNoPermissions)
   10684             : 
   10685             : {
   10686             :     struct config_generic *gconf;
   10687             : 
   10688             :     /*
   10689             :      * There are three cases to consider:
   10690             :      *
   10691             :      * name is a known GUC variable.  Check the value normally, check
   10692             :      * permissions normally (i.e., allow if variable is USERSET, or if it's
   10693             :      * SUSET and user is superuser).
   10694             :      *
   10695             :      * name is not known, but exists or can be created as a placeholder (i.e.,
   10696             :      * it has a prefixed name).  We allow this case if you're a superuser,
   10697             :      * otherwise not.  Superusers are assumed to know what they're doing. We
   10698             :      * can't allow it for other users, because when the placeholder is
   10699             :      * resolved it might turn out to be a SUSET variable;
   10700             :      * define_custom_variable assumes we checked that.
   10701             :      *
   10702             :      * name is not known and can't be created as a placeholder.  Throw error,
   10703             :      * unless skipIfNoPermissions is true, in which case return false.
   10704             :      */
   10705          38 :     gconf = find_option(name, true, WARNING);
   10706          38 :     if (!gconf)
   10707             :     {
   10708             :         /* not known, failed to make a placeholder */
   10709           0 :         if (skipIfNoPermissions)
   10710           0 :             return false;
   10711           0 :         ereport(ERROR,
   10712             :                 (errcode(ERRCODE_UNDEFINED_OBJECT),
   10713             :                  errmsg("unrecognized configuration parameter \"%s\"",
   10714             :                         name)));
   10715             :     }
   10716             : 
   10717          38 :     if (gconf->flags & GUC_CUSTOM_PLACEHOLDER)
   10718             :     {
   10719             :         /*
   10720             :          * We cannot do any meaningful check on the value, so only permissions
   10721             :          * are useful to check.
   10722             :          */
   10723           0 :         if (superuser())
   10724           0 :             return true;
   10725           0 :         if (skipIfNoPermissions)
   10726           0 :             return false;
   10727           0 :         ereport(ERROR,
   10728             :                 (errcode(ERRCODE_INSUFFICIENT_PRIVILEGE),
   10729             :                  errmsg("permission denied to set parameter \"%s\"", name)));
   10730             :     }
   10731             : 
   10732             :     /* manual permissions check so we can avoid an error being thrown */
   10733          38 :     if (gconf->context == PGC_USERSET)
   10734             :          /* ok */ ;
   10735           2 :     else if (gconf->context == PGC_SUSET && superuser())
   10736             :          /* ok */ ;
   10737           0 :     else if (skipIfNoPermissions)
   10738           0 :         return false;
   10739             :     /* if a permissions error should be thrown, let set_config_option do it */
   10740             : 
   10741             :     /* test for permissions and valid option value */
   10742          38 :     (void) set_config_option(name, value,
   10743          38 :                              superuser() ? PGC_SUSET : PGC_USERSET,
   10744             :                              PGC_S_TEST, GUC_ACTION_SET, false, 0, false);
   10745             : 
   10746          38 :     return true;
   10747             : }

   10749             : 
   10750             : /*
   10751             :  * Called by check_hooks that want to override the normal
   10752             :  * ERRCODE_INVALID_PARAMETER_VALUE SQLSTATE for check hook failures.
   10753             :  *
   10754             :  * Note that GUC_check_errmsg() etc are just macros that result in a direct

   10947             : static bool
   10948        1228 : check_wal_consistency_checking(char **newval, void **extra, GucSource source)
   10949             : {
   10950             :     char       *rawstring;

   10963             :     {

   10970             : 
   10971        1228 :     foreach(l, elemlist)

   11010             :     }

   11199             : static bool
   11200        5150 : check_timezone_abbreviations(char **newval, void **extra, GucSource source)
   11201             : {
   11202             :     /*
   11203             :      * The boot_val given above for timezone_abbreviations is NULL. When we
   11204             :      * see this we just do nothing.  If this value isn't overridden from the
   11205             :      * config file then pg_timezone_abbrev_initialize() will eventually
   11206             :      * replace it with "Default".  This hack has two purposes: to avoid
   11207             :      * wasting cycles loading values that might soon be overridden from the
   11208             :      * config file, and to avoid trying to read the timezone abbrev files
   11209             :      * during InitializeGUCOptions().  The latter doesn't work in an
   11210             :      * EXEC_BACKEND subprocess because my_exec_path hasn't been set yet and so
   11211             :      * we can't locate PGSHAREDIR.
   11212             :      */
   11213        5150 :     if (*newval == NULL)
   11214             :     {
   11215        1974 :         Assert(source == PGC_S_DEFAULT);
   11216        1974 :         return true;
   11217             :     }
   11218             : 
   11219             :     /* OK, load the file and produce a malloc'd TimeZoneAbbrevTable */
   11220        3176 :     *extra = load_tzoffsets(*newval);
   11221             : 
   11222             :     /* tzparser.c returns NULL on failure, reporting via GUC_check_errmsg */
   11223        3176 :     if (!*extra)
   11224           0 :         return false;
   11225             : 
   11226        3176 :     return true;
   11227             : }

   11265             : static void
   11266        1228 : assign_tcp_keepalives_idle(int newval, void *extra)
   11267             : {
   11268             :     /*
   11269             :      * The kernel API provides no way to test a value without setting it; and
   11270             :      * once we set it we might fail to unset it.  So there seems little point
   11271             :      * in fully implementing the check-then-assign GUC API for these
   11272             :      * variables.  Instead we just do the assignment on demand.  pqcomm.c
   11273             :      * reports any problems via elog(LOG).
   11274             :      *
   11275             :      * This approach means that the GUC value might have little to do with the
   11276             :      * actual kernel value, so we use a show_hook that retrieves the kernel
   11277             :      * value rather than trusting GUC's copy.
   11278             :      */
   11279        1228 :     (void) pq_setkeepalivesidle(newval, MyProcPort);
   11280        1228 : }

   11509             : static const char *
   11510           2 : show_data_directory_mode(void)
   11511             : {
   11512             :     static char buf[12];
   11513             : 
   11514           2 :     snprintf(buf, sizeof(buf), "%04o", data_directory_mode);
   11515           2 :     return buf;
   11516             : }
   11517             : 
   11518             : /*
   11519             :  * We split the input string, where commas separate function names
   11520             :  * and certain whitespace chars are ignored, into a \0-separated (and
   11521             :  * \0\0-terminated) list of function names.  This formulation allows
   11522             :  * easy scanning when an error is thrown while avoiding the use of
   11523             :  * non-reentrant strtok(), as well as keeping the output data in a
   11524             :  * single palloc() chunk.
   11525             :  */
   11526             : static bool
   11527        1228 : check_backtrace_functions(char **newval, void **extra, GucSource source)
   11528             : {
   11529        1228 :     int         newvallen = strlen(*newval);
   11530             :     char       *someval;
   11531             :     int         validlen;
   11532             :     int         i;
   11533             :     int         j;
   11534             : 
   11535             :     /*
   11536             :      * Allow characters that can be C identifiers and commas as separators, as
   11537             :      * well as some whitespace for readability.
   11538             :      */
   11539        1228 :     validlen = strspn(*newval,
   11540             :                       "0123456789_"
   11541             :                       "abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz"
   11542             :                       "ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ"
   11543             :                       ", \n\t");
   11544        1228 :     if (validlen != newvallen)
   11545             :     {
   11546           0 :         GUC_check_errdetail("invalid character");
   11547           0 :         return false;
   11548             :     }
   11549             : 
   11550        1228 :     if (*newval[0] == '\0')
   11551             :     {
   11552        1228 :         *extra = NULL;
   11553        1228 :         return true;
   11554             :     }
   11555             : 
   11556             :     /*

   11558             :      * whitespace chars to save some memory, but it doesn't seem worth the
   11559             :      * trouble.
   11560             :      */

   11562           0 :     for (i = 0, j = 0; i < newvallen; i++)
   11563             :     {

   11565           0 :             someval[j++] = '\0';    /* next item */
   11566           0 :         else if ((*newval)[i] == ' ' ||
   11567           0 :                  (*newval)[i] == '\n' ||
   11568           0 :                  (*newval)[i] == '\t')

   11570             :         else
   11571           0 :             someval[j++] = (*newval)[i];    /* copy anything else */
   11572             :     }
   11573             : 
   11574             :     /* two \0s end the setting */
   11575           0 :     someval[j] = '\0';

   11577             : 
   11578           0 :     *extra = someval;
   11579           0 :     return true;

   11624             :     else
   11625        1228 :         recoveryTargetTLIRequested = 0;
   11626        1228 : }
   11627             : 
   11628             : /*
   11629             :  * Recovery target settings: Only one of the several recovery_target* settings
   11630             :  * may be set.  Setting a second one results in an error.  The global variable
   11631             :  * recoveryTarget tracks which kind of recovery target was chosen.  Other
   11632             :  * variables store the actual target value (for example a string or a xid).
   11633             :  * The assign functions of the parameters check whether a competing parameter
   11634             :  * was already set.  But we want to allow setting the same parameter multiple
   11635             :  * times.  We also want to allow unsetting a parameter and setting a different
   11636             :  * one, so we unset recoveryTarget when the parameter is set to an empty
   11637             :  * string.
   11638             :  */
   11639             : 
   11640             : static void
   11641             : pg_attribute_noreturn()
   11642           0 : error_multiple_recovery_targets(void)
   11643             : {
   11644           0 :     ereport(ERROR,
   11645             :             (errcode(ERRCODE_INVALID_PARAMETER_VALUE),
   11646             :              errmsg("multiple recovery targets specified"),
   11647             :              errdetail("At most one of recovery_target, recovery_target_lsn, recovery_target_name, recovery_target_time, recovery_target_xid may be set.")));
   11648             : }
   11649             :

   11710             : /*
   11711             :  * The interpretation of the recovery_target_time string can depend on the
